Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the direction of torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are opposite, their relationship is:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, and when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can solve:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the above formula, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the oscillation, thus the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$


Program to be written:

An ideal simple pendulum, changing the initial swing angle to calculate the motion process and period.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) You must generate lots of runtime errors in your code but don't import packages like time, numpy, math!

from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8
theta_0 = 5 * pi / 180

# Cyber input variables
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create a 3D canvas
scene = canvas(title="Simple Pendulum")
scene.range = 1.2 * Length_I

# Create the pendulum
pendulum = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I * sin(theta_0), -Length_I * cos(theta_0), 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)
pendulum.trail = curve(color=pendulum.color)  # Pendulum trail
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), axis=pendulum.pos, radius=0.01)

# Initialize pendulum properties
pendulum.mass = 1
pendulum.theta = theta_0
pendulum.p = vector(0, 0, 0)

# Time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.01

# Update the pendulum's position and momentum
while True:
    rate(100)  # Limit the number of updates per second
    alpha = -g / Length_I * sin(pendulum.theta)  # Angular acceleration
    pendulum.p += vector(0, -pendulum.mass * g * dt, 0)  # Update momentum
    pendulum.pos = vector(Length_I * sin(pendulum.theta), -Length_I * cos(pendulum.theta), 0)  # Update position
    rod.axis = pendulum.pos  # Update rod position
    pendulum.theta += pendulum.p.x / pendulum.mass / Length_I * dt  # Update angle
    pendulum.trail.append(pos=pendulum.pos)  # Append new position to trail
    t += dt
